moves.4... Bc5: I have been dying to play this variation for ages now
moves.5... Bxf2+ 6. Kxf2: Again not recommended. Play is just too wild if white takes on f2 and white usually comes off worse
moves.6... Nxe4+ 7. Ke3: Again not the best continuation. this just exposes the king to too much attacking combinations.
moves.7... Qh4: Now white needs to make the correct move or he will be sorry.
moves.8. Nxh8: ??? Wrong move. Mate is now unavoidable.
moves.8... Qf4+:
Both Ke2 and Kd3 lead to mate. If Kd3 then Nb4+ Ke2 Qf2#

If Ke2 then Qf2+ Kd3 Nc5+ Kc3 Qd4#
moves.9. Ke2: White chosses the option that holds out longest
moves.9... Qf2+ 10. Kd3 Nc5+ 11. Kc3 Qd4#: Hope you enjoyed this quick game. Played in one day :)

opening: two knights defence (C57), Wilkes Barre (Traxler) variation
